results.title: The Human skeleton. Part 3. Muscles, movements and pressure
results.creator_credit: Beryl Denman Lacey, Frank Wells and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: Shows the workings of muscles and tendons within the human skeletal structure, with main emphasis on the diaphragm and the muscles required to maintain a human in an erect position.

results.title: The Human skeleton. Part 2. Muscles, movement and posture
results.creator_credit: Beryl Denman Lacey, Frank Wells and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: Shows by live-action, animated diagram and radiology, the position, attachment, and function of the muscles relative to the bones and joints; the movements of the arm and of respiration; and the action of the muscles in maintaining posture in the standing and moving positions.

results.title: The Human Jigsaw (Captioned)
results.brief_description: This documentary, that tells of one of Australia’s most successful efforts to fight drug addiction, is a “no holds barred” view on Odyssey House in Sydney and its drug rehabilitation program told by the residents undergoing treatment. It shows the progressive degradation of people through drug addiction to the depths of despair and hopelessness and the way in which the Odyssey program rebuilds shattered lives. The story addresses the cynicism of many people to the problems and reasons of addiction and cure.

The story addresses the cynicism of many people to the problems and reasons of addiction and cure.
